page.title: 04TREES AND HEDGES IN THE VALE
page.content: { How To Tell The Age Of A Hedgerow We measured 27m of hedgerow and in those 27m we had to find all the different trees,shrubs and bushes we could.If you found 3 different types the hedge would be about 300 years old.We measured two lengths of hedge in the Vale(O/S G.Ref.SK 529655).One was 400 years old and the other was 300 years old. { Sarah Swannack, Class 5 S.E. { Trees In The Vale We also took a rough percentage count of the trees along the river between the two stone bridges(O/S G. Ref.SK 527652 and 532654).Hawthorne 24% Wych Elm 17% Elder 14% Beech 10.5% Oak 8.5% Silver Birch 8% Hornbeam 4% Larch 4% Rowen 4% Sycamore 4% Willow 2.5% Black Poplar 2% Hazel 2% Alder 2% Ash 1% Norway Spruce 1% These figures can be compared with those for{Hind Car Wood.
